markdown: | icon = poe2 pet_wurm_sky icon.png | description = This newly hatched Sky Wurm was carried across the ocean by an enterprising band of xaurips intent on making a new home in the Deadfire. While the Sky Dragon wurm is following you around you deal more damage with ranged weapon attacks, and your party gains increased Accuracy, Deflection, and Reflexes vs. distant targets. | added_in = poe2 | equipment_slot = Pet | item_type = Pet | item_category = Other item | requirements = | is_soulbound = no | is_unique = no | value = 60 | shop_value = 300 | range = | level1_spells = | level2_spells = | level3_spells = | level4_spells = | level5_spells = | level6_spells = | level7_spells = | level8_spells = | item_bonuses = | enchantments = Pet bonus: Damage multiplier - Ranged;Pet party effect: Defenses - Distant enemies | rel_quests = | rel_items = | rel_abilities = | rel_talents = | internalname = ITEM_PET_SkyWurm | location = * [Oathbinder's Sanctum](/oathbindersSanctum/): A "Strange Egg" in the xaurip nest. {{legacy|poe1}} Only appears if: ** You did not kill the Sky Dragon in {{poe1}}, and you allowed it to stay in the [Temple of Hylea](/templeOfHylea/). ** You severely wounded the Sky Dragon and drove it off (cut) ** Or if you specifically killed the Sky Dragon Wurmling in {{poe1}}. | guid = a2828540-ba46-440b-934d-71467ccf6bd1 }} '''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Pet}} in {{poe2}}. ## Description {{Description |{{#var:description}}}} ## Acquisition {{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}} ## Trivia * With Eder in the party, and the wurm equipped, he'll randomly say "Who's a good wurm? Who's a good wurm?" ## Notes * If you don't meet the requirements, use one of the following console commands to enable the strange egg: ** [SetGlobalValue](/consoleSetGlobalValue/) n_Nest_Wurmling_State 1 (before entering area) ** [SetGlobalValue](/consoleSetGlobalValue/) n_Nest_Wurmling_State & [SetGlobalValue](/consoleSetGlobalValue/) n_Nest_dragon_State 2 (before entering area) ** [ActivateObject](/consoleActivateObject/) 85f85aee-4fc3-40d2-9615-380b11008d52 true * Or simply just give yourself the pet: ** [GiveItem](/consoleGiveItem/) ITEM_PET_SkyWurm * Note that the global values set by the legacy history creator do not necessarily reflect the values that would be present if you imported a save file with the same decisions. Notably, creating a legacy history with the option: ** "I killed the dragon" will not cause the egg to appear. ** "I severely wounded the sky dragon and drove it off" will cause the egg to appear.
raw: {{Infobox item poe2 | name = {{pagename nd}} | icon = poe2 pet_wurm_sky icon.png | description = This newly hatched Sky Wurm was carried across the ocean by an enterprising band of xaurips intent on making a new home in the Deadfire. While the Sky Dragon wurm is following you around you deal more damage with ranged weapon attacks, and your party gains increased Accuracy, Deflection, and Reflexes vs. distant targets. | added_in = poe2 | equipment_slot = Pet | item_type = Pet | item_category = Other item | requirements = | is_soulbound = no | is_unique = no | value = 60 | shop_value = 300 | range = | level1_spells = | level2_spells = | level3_spells = | level4_spells = | level5_spells = | level6_spells = | level7_spells = | level8_spells = | item_bonuses = | enchantments = Pet bonus: Damage multiplier - Ranged;Pet party effect: Defenses - Distant enemies | rel_quests = | rel_items = | rel_abilities = | rel_talents = | internalname = ITEM_PET_SkyWurm | location = * [[Oathbinder's Sanctum]]: A "Strange Egg" in the xaurip nest. {{legacy|poe1}} Only appears if: ** You did not kill the Sky Dragon in {{poe1}}, and you allowed it to stay in the [[Temple of Hylea]]. ** You severely wounded the Sky Dragon and drove it off (cut) ** Or if you specifically killed the Sky Dragon Wurmling in {{poe1}}. | guid = a2828540-ba46-440b-934d-71467ccf6bd1 }} '''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Pet}} in {{poe2}}. == Description == {{Description |{{#var:description}}}} == Acquisition == {{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}} == Trivia == * With Eder in the party, and the wurm equipped, he'll randomly say "Who's a good wurm? Who's a good wurm?" ==Notes== * If you don't meet the requirements, use one of the following console commands to enable the strange egg: ** [[Console#SetGlobalValue|SetGlobalValue]] n_Nest_Wurmling_State 1 (before entering area) ** [[Console#SetGlobalValue|SetGlobalValue]] n_Nest_Wurmling_State & [[Console#SetGlobalValue|SetGlobalValue]] n_Nest_dragon_State 2 (before entering area) ** [[Console#ActivateObject|ActivateObject]] 85f85aee-4fc3-40d2-9615-380b11008d52 true * Or simply just give yourself the pet: ** [[Console#GiveItem|GiveItem]] ITEM_PET_SkyWurm * Note that the global values set by the legacy history creator do not necessarily reflect the values that would be present if you imported a save file with the same decisions. Notably, creating a legacy history with the option: ** "I killed the dragon" will not cause the egg to appear. ** "I severely wounded the sky dragon and drove it off" will cause the egg to appear.
title: Sky Dragon Wurm
